intro: Tephroseris integrifolia var. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-leaved tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and white to pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, entire leaves and is often found in sagebrush steppe ecosystems.
